citation.article-title: Saxeibacter lacteus gen. nov., sp. nov., an actinobacterium isolated from rock.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Saxeibacter lacteus sp. nov.
Saxeibacter lacteus (lac.te′us. L. masc. adj. lacteus milk-coloured, milky).
Colonies are cream-coloured, circular, smooth and convex, reaching 0.5–1.0 mm in diameter.
The morphological and chemotaxonomic characteristics are the same as those given in the genus description.
The temperature and pH ranges for growth are 4–37 °C and pH 5.1–9.1.
No growth occurs at 0 or 42 °C, at pH 4.1 or above pH 10.1.
Grows at NaCl concentrations up to 3 %; does not grow in the presence of 4 % NaCl.
Positive for hydrolysis of DNA; negative for hydrolysis of chitin, CM-cellulose and elastin.

The following tests in the API 20E system are negative: H2S production, utilization of citrate, indole production and Voges–Proskauer reaction, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, urease, tryptophan deaminase and gelatinase.
In the API ZYM system, tests for leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-mannosidase are positive.
Weakly positive for esterase lipase (C8) and acid phosphatase.

Negative for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase and α-fucosidase.

l-Arabinose, myo-inositol and methyl α-d-mannoside are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources, but benzoate, cellobiose, citrate, dextran, d-dulcitol, meso-erythritol, formate, methyl α-d-glucoside, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, l-sorbose, dl-tartrate, trehalose and d-xylitol are not used.
Other physiological properties are given in Table 1.
The predominant fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 (25.8 %), C16 : 0 (19.6 %), iso-C16 : 0 (15.7 %) and anteiso-C17 : 0 (15.0 %).
The DNA G+C content is 74.3 mol%.
The type strain, DLS-10T (=KCTC 19285T =DSM 19367T), was isolated from a rock sample collected from the peak of Darangshi Oreum (a small mountain, 300 m above sea level) in Jeju, Republic of Korea.
